purpose: Extracting account ID from Wasm stack
analysis:
This code uses WebAssembly to extract an account ID from a given Wasm stack.

The function `getInt32Memory0()` retrieves data from the Wasm stack.

The variable `ptr` is initialized to point to the start of the stack.

The function then uses `getUint8Memory0().subarray()` to extract the account ID from the stack.

The code checks if the last element of the stack is not zero. If it is, it sets `ptr1` to zero and `len1` to zero, and throws an error.

The function returns the extracted account ID as a string.
conclusion:
This code extracts an account ID from a given Wasm stack using WebAssembly.

The function `getInt32Memory0()` retrieves data from the Wasm stack.

The variable `ptr` is initialized to point to the start of the stack.

The function then uses `getUint8Memory0().subarray()` to extract the account ID from the stack.

The code checks if the last element of the stack is not zero. If it is, it sets `ptr1` to zero and `len1` to zero, and throws an error.

The function returns the extracted account ID as a string.
